text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen today 
because I'm in Thailand we're going to do

something a little fun and interesting I'm going 
to show you how coconut milk gets made now I have

to preface this with this is actually the 
first time I'm going to open this coconut

usually when I used to make coconut milk as a 
kid it's been opened for me by an adult because

it requires wielding a big cleaver but today 
hey for hot thai kitchen we're going to do

it together so this is an old coconut and this 
is not the kind of the kind of coconut you get

your coconut water from those are young coconut 
there's water in here but the older the coconut

the thicker the flesh and that thick flesh gets 
creamy and fatty and that's where the coconut

milk comes from so this had a big hairy husk on 
it and it's been taken off and it's been shaved

with like literally with a knife just kind of 
shave like that so that you don't get too much

hair in the coconut water when we release it so 
the first thing we're going to do is crack it

so that the water comes out so we can deal with 
it without water splashing everywhere so okay

this is my second time ever so maybe this will 
go slightly better than the first time oh it's

cracked there I just heard it so I try to split it 
so all the water comes out and this coconut water

is completely drinkable it's actually sweeter 
than the young coconut water that gets you know

turn into commercial coconut water whoa there's 
more water so oh I'm so excited about this the

first my first one didn't come out this pretty 
but here we go so now we've got this beautiful

old coconut and now we're going to grate this 
meat using my special tool the rabbit alright

so here's the heart I'm familiar with I used 
to do this a lot growing up so I be handed a

coconut just like this and then we would use 
this thing which is a coconut grading chair

also known as the rabbit and okay it's not known 
as the rabbit we call it goodbye and that means

rabbit for reasons unbeknownst me I guess some 
in some ways it looks like a rabbit but it has

this really sharp blade and then you just grade 
it just like that and as you can see it's really

quite moist and juicy and then we're going to take 
that and squeeze all the coconut milk out of it

this is one of those things people don't 
do anymore okay like I'm completely going

back in time here nowadays people either buy the 
coconut already graded and then they milk their

own coconut milk or they just buy premade coconut 
milk but there's nothing like fresh coconut milk

but flavor the aroma is so much better than 
any kind of canned or you know preserved type

of coconut milk and you know why when I was little 
I liked this stuff this is fun so this is what it

looks like when it's done well I could push it a 
little bit further but I'm getting a little tired

so I think we've got enough as you can see in some 
parts I went a little far and I dug out the the

shell it's not a big deal for coconut milk but you 
know if you're using it for a dessert or something

you don't want the brown bits contaminated into 
the white fluffy coconut so normally if you were

to industrially make this you can make a hundred 
percent coconut milk meaning you just take this

with nothing at it and put it through like a 
squishing Machine and then the Machine just

squishes out all the coconut milk however at home 
we can't squish as hard as those machines they're

going to need a little bit of help so we like to 
add a little bit of hot water into the coconut

meat and then it makes the the milking a little 
bit easier and then you just squeeze it with your

hands so really just go in and you'll see as you 
squeeze the coconut milk will come running out and

that's coconut milk right there and when I was a 
kid I would just do this for like 15 minutes and

I just keep going because it's really fun okay 
so now that I've got this I'm going to squeeze

it into a strainer and this trainer is very 
traditional I think this has been here since

I was born and squeeze it over the strainer and 
that's it that's fresh coconut milk bat fly ah

okay and then I'm going to save this and set it 
aside because I want to go back and I can try

to milk even more coconut milk out of that and 
then what I'll get is what we call hang Kathy or

basically the second press it's a thinner coconut 
milk it definitely has its uses but this first

press is the more concentrated creamier creamier 
version so whoo there we go and that's it that's

how you make fresh coconut milk old school as you 
can see we didn't get a whole lot of coconut milk

so this is a lot of work right and that's why when 
I was little I was used to make coconut milk a lot

but I think it's a great experience if you get 
a chance if you have get a hold of a coconut you

should give it a try and you can really experience 
what fresh coconut milk tastes like and smell like

and it's also quite a lot of fun as well so I 
hope you enjoyed this episode and I will see

you next time for your next delicious time now if 
you are a guy you would just straddle this thing

and just put the coconut between your legs but 
as a lady this is sort of the more appropriate

position to do this in but if you're by yourself 
just go ahead and do whatever is comfortable right
